snippet: The institution announced that it would increase its capacity to lend to middle-income countries like China, India and Brazil from $15 billion to as much as $28 billion a year.
abstract: World Bank says it is nearly doubling its potential lending to so-called middle-income countries like China, India and Brazil, adding about $100 billion in new financing capacity over the next decade.
lead_paragraph: The institution announced that it would increase its capacity to lend to middle-income countries like China, India and Brazil from $15 billion to as much as $28 billion a year.
